intro: Eriosema mirabile, commonly known as the velvetleaf sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive velvety leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its primary botanical interest lies in its unique leaf structure and floral morphology.
